page.title: 02Population in Bromp on Swale
page.content: The population of the village at the Census in 1981 was 1,060, a 50% increase from 1971 at 714. In 1881 it was 509 though it did fall to 361 in 1901. Families still living here who were mentioned in the 1871 Census are as follows:-still farming are Hunter, Peacock, Wilkin, Bond and Thompson while the Longs are still wagon drivers. Russel joiner now farmer, Barker housekeeper now milkman, Moore station master now taxi driver, Simpson scholar now housewife, Fryer inn keeper now council worker. To accommodate the recent upsurge in population, 5 new estates have been built.These residents commute to work by private transport via the new motorway.
